An operating system designed for the NHS

Secure, modern, affordable, open source, and free - it's the solution to the modern cybersecurity challenge, rising Windows licensing costs and creaking NHS hardware. Register your interest now.

NHSbuntu is a free, Ubuntu-based Linux operating system for the NHS. It's a secure, reliable OS that excels in both clinical and non-clinical NHS settings, and comes with the right stuff to be productive - out of the box.

Long term supported Ubuntu 16.04 LTS base

— benefit from the stable codebase and huge app ecosystem of one of the most popular and widely-adopted Linux variants.

Multi-environment

— works as a clinical OS, an office desktop OS, in Kiosk Mode for simple transactions and displays, and as a real-time dashboard.

Encrypted By Default

— full-disk encrypted by default, whether used as a Live USB system, or installed to the hard disk.

Office Applications

— a complete office suite comes built into NHSbuntu, saving trusts thousands in licensing fees for proprietary office suites.

Email Client

— the Thunderbird email client, preconfigured to easily and simply connect to NHSmail and Trust email

NHS Spine Two-factor Authentication (2FA)

— support for smart Cards auth and Oxygen CIS is built into NHSbuntu, making Spine-approved 2FA a first-class citizen in the OS, not a bolt on SSO hack, or a creaky Java system-tray app.

DICOM Viewer

— Ginkgo CADx, a standard DICOM clinical imaging viewer, comes installed as standard.

  • Free to deploy on an unlimited number of machines.

  • Open source - no vendor lock-in to a particular platform. Never be stuck up XP Creek without an upgrade paddle

  • Benefits from Linux's inbuilt multi-user architecture and inherently secure architecture.

  • Low system RAM and CPU requirements mean it performs well even on older hardware. Or use low cost, single-board hardware like the Intel NUC

  • Automatic security updates, to reduce risk of malware and virus attacks that can cause downtime or a catastrophic patient data leak.

  • Designed for highly automatable remote management and optimisation of machines, saving your IT team money and time.

  • Get the latest of everything, with no upgrade costs.

  • Ubuntu creates a developer-friendly deployment environment that allows trusts to develop new solutions rapidly, using any technology platform.

  • Take advantage of extremely low-cost computing platforms, such as Raspberry Pi, Intel Compute Stick, for simple displays and dashboards that bring the power of technology into everyday operations, while saving money on hardware.

Other Features

Dashboard and Analytics

— built in tools and prebuilt dashboards for the most common NHS targets and KPIs.

Per-user customisations

— synchronised between logins, from a secure server you control. Clinicians can customise their environments to optimise their efficiency, automate workflows, and be more effective. Industry-standard keyboard shortcuts for every application.

Launch applications and workflows from the keyboard

— built-in extensible Launcher app saves time and improves productivity.

Secure Instant Messaging for NHS Teams

— IM hosted inside the Health and Social Care Network, complete with desktop, iOS and Android mobile clients, and designed for the kinds of teams that exist in the NHS.

Voice recognition Input

— offline and secure voice recognition makes data input super-fast, satisfies Information Governance requirements and can be used for Patient Identifiable Data (PID).

Android containerization

— use Android apps on NHSbuntu in the Desktop Mode, in Kiosk Mode, even on a Raspberry Pi

Patient information displays

— display health promotion information, important organisation-wide bulletins, or real-time alerts and waiting times to your patients

Virtualisation and Emulation

— Run Windows applications in NHSbuntu using VirtualBox, Mono and Wine. Legacy applications need not force the Trust-wide purchase of an expensive, bloated and consumer-oriented Windows 10, or prevent you upgrading from an insecure legacy Windows XP.

Remote Support and Login

— built in standards-compliant remote support application, and remote desktop login.
